head.title: 5B Technologies' Profit Built on Record Revenues

hedline.hl1: 5B Technologies' Profit Built on Record Revenues

abstract.p: 5B Technology Corp of Jericho, Long Island, posts record revenue of $7.5 million in second quarter 2000; reports pretax net income of $45,000, compared with pretax loss of $358,000 a year earlier (S)

block.p: The 5B Technologies Corporation of Jericho (Nasdaq: FIVE) posted record revenues of $7.5 million in the second quarter, more than triple the $2.3 million of the year earlier. Consolidated revenues more than doubled, to $9.5 million from $4.1 million.

Pretax net income was $45,000, in contrast to a pretax loss of $358,000 a year earlier. Consolidated net income from continuing operations was $39,000, or 2 cents a share, in contrast to a net loss in the second quarter last year of $47,000.

The 5B Technologies Corporation of Jericho (Nasdaq: FIVE) posted record revenues of $7.5 million in the second quarter, more than triple the $2.3 million of the year earlier. Consolidated revenues more than doubled, to $9.5 million from $4.1 million.

Pretax net income was $45,000, in contrast to a pretax loss of $358,000 a year earlier. Consolidated net income from continuing operations was $39,000, or 2 cents a share, in contrast to a net loss in the second quarter last year of $47,000.
The company, formerly Paratech Resources Inc., attributed the turnaround to increased sales of hardware and software driven by infrastructure projects.
